div.head: A brefe apologye or anſwere to a certen craftye cloynar, or popyſhe paraſyte, called Thomas ſmȳthe.

q.p: ¶ Beholde the diſceytfull penne of the ſcrybe, hath ſet forthe lyes.

lg.l: SEr, though ye be a ſmytheEſaie. 9.
And beate vppon the ſtythe
ye cum nat to the pythe
Nor haue not yet wher wythe
your ſpyryt is verye drye
The ſcripturs to applyeEzec. 13.
ye rather them denye
Than ther trewthe fortyfye
Vvbat meaſur ye obſerue
In poeſye proterueEccl. 19.
Axe of ladye mynerue
And ſhe wyll ſaye ye ſwerue
Full flatterynglye ye foyne
ye clatter and ye cloyneprou. 10
ye mangye matters ioyne
And all to catche the coyne
ye cobble and ye clowght
To vpholde the romyſhe rowght
But ye maye haue the gowghtHie. 50.
Ere ye brynge that abowght
ye maynteyne ſodomytes
with other hypocrytes
And playe the paraſytesAbac. 2
To ſlee trewe iſraelytes
Agaynſt aftrawe ye ſtumble
And at a blocke ye fumble
Ye fare lyke hym that tumble
For nought ye do but bumble.Math. 7
Soche one ye are ywys
As popyſhe preſtes maye blys
For wher all treaſon ys
Ye fynde nothynge amys.Eſal. 56,
Your hate ye can not hyde
Nor yet your popyſhe prydeLuc. 21.
God wyll for hysprouyde
Whan ye ſhall ſtande aſyde
Whyls you ſuppreſſe the ryght
Here wanderynge in the nyghtIoh. 12.
Ye thynke God hath no ſyght
Which is the very lyght
The lorde wyll once out ſpewe
Soche hypocrytes vntrewe
As byddethhys worde adewe
Pylde poperye to renewe.Apoc. 3
For curſed is that hart
And worthye to haue ſmartHie. 48.
Whych wyll with them take part
That ſcripture doth peruart

l.hi: To trolle awaye or trolle in / let not trolle ſpare
Yf trolle trewlye trolle / trolle nedeth not to care

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: Trolle in hath trolled trewlye, wher trolle awaye trolled amys
Yf ye wyll trolle with trollars,Oſee. 5. trolle trewlyar after thys
Full lyke a troblous trollar, ye trolle a tryfelynge trace
Trolle nomore with the ſcripturs, except ye haue better grace

head.bibl: Thomas ſmythe. ☞ A lyttle treatyſe agaynſt ſedicions perſones.

l.hi: OF late I peruſed / two purpoſes ſeuerall
In thee kyndes craftlye handled / the treuthe for to tell
Trolle awaye / and trolle in, menne do them call
Treatynge vpon matter / concernynge the late Cromwell
The one vtterlye myndynge / the other to repell
Trolle awaye (the treuthe is) moche touched the quycke
And trolle in (ſom what galled) be ganne for to kycke

lg.head: ¶ An anſwere to the bolſterar of ſedicion.
lg.l: In your peruſinge, ye ſeme very parciall
Trolle awaye iugynge,Gene. 8. of treuth to haue the trycke
Concernynge Cromwell, trolle in nothyng at all
But for hystrollynge, to be an heretycke
Trollynge betwixt them,Rom. 7. ye are a iuge to quycke
The worſe to allowe, the better to condempne
Soche vntrewe trollars, all veryte contempne.
Whan Criſt was alyue,Iohā. 5. ſoche tr yfelinge trollars trolled
Callynge hym traytour, and herety cke alſo
Whome for ther trollynge, the phary ſees extolled
As yet to thys daye, ther trewe ſucceſſours do
Dyd notſoche trollars, agaynſt the apoſtles go?Act. 4.
What ther rewarde is, we nede not for to tell
Trollynges trouthe troblynge, trolleth euermore to hell.

l.hi: Yet trolle awaye tolde trouthe / yt can not be denyed
Declarynge the offences / wherin Cromwell offended
Trolle in beynge trobled / whan he yt eſpyed
With trollynges to couer it, ſubtyllye contended
Some trollats ther be / I wolde were amended
For who that craftelye coloureth / any others offence
Of lykely hode in hys owne hart / hath the ſame pretence.

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: Trolle awaye ded lye,Pro. 12. in manye thynges he tolde
Though the lorde Cromwell, hath dyed for hys offence
So ſone as trolle in, ſoche trollynges ded beholde
He ſhewed hym of it,Gala. 6. with moche more grace and ſcyence
Betwyne them yetrolle,Gala. 6. without indifference
your verdyt is nought, your iugement is wurſe
Soche vntrewe trollars, are vnderneth goddes curſe
No wreche ſo wycked,Ro. 10. but ſome wyll take hys part
None ſo vnlerned, but ſome ſhall hym vpholde
As menne ſe profyght, ſo trolle they in ther hart
Some that hath knowlege, are neyther hote norcolde
And verye aſſe heades,Apoc. 3 auctoryte maketh bolde
He that with the fote, ſo cruell partes wyll playe
The head wyll not ſpare, he once out of the waye.

l.hi: Trewlye to trolle, it is no maner of ſhame
And trollynge vntrewe / is nat to be mayntayned
As euerye thynge is / ſo to geue it proppre name
Amonges all trewe honeſt men / ſhuld nat be dyſdayned
The ſcripture ſo teacheth vs / it can not be fayned
Agaynſt ſcripture who ſtryueth / he is non other lyke
Than a traytour to hys prynce / and to God an heretyke

lg.head: An anſwere.Ve qui dicitis bonum malum & malū bonum Eſa. v. Eph. 4.
lg.l: If trewlye to trolle, ſtande with moche honeſte
And trollynge vntrewe, requyreth rebuke and ſhame
I gretlye maruele, whyls you a trollar be
That in your trollynge, ye wyll trewe trollars blame
And for your purpoſe,Eccl. 3. trolle ſcripturs out offrame
Soche trecherous trollars, I thynke to be no leſſe
Than thoſe lewde perſons, whome ye do here expreſſe
your ſcripture ye trolle,Eſai. 5. from Eſaye the fyft
Ther ſpoken for them, that doth goddes worde blaſpheme
But ye can make it, to ſerue an other dryft
Than God that tyme ſhewed,Mat. 16. or Eſaye coude eſteme
Soche trollynge of trouthe, cauſe yet ſome men to deme
The byſſ hop of Rome, the chefe head of the churche
Scripturs ſo trolled, lyke myſter yes canne wurche.

l.hi: I intende not to trolle, to rake anye part
Diuiſion to mcreace, it nedeth nothynge
But ſorowfullye ſyghynge / I trolle in my hart
With my ſelf in mynde / manye tymes reuoluynge
How God to vs hath ordayned / the moſt noble kynge
Who 〈◊〉 connyt vs / hath trauayled full fore
yet manye teyfelynge trollars / care lyttele therfore.

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: A blacke more wyll change,Hier. 13. the colour of hys ſkynne
As ſone as hys craft, an hypocryte ſhall hyde
ye trolle with no part, dyuyſion to begynne
And yet the people, from Criſt ye wold dyuyde
Some trollars lament,Ioan. 11. the fallynge of ther pryde
Chriſten kynges hauynge, ſoche trollars at ther hande
Are in worſe takynge, than they do vnderſtande
Vvho maketh dyuiſion?Ioan. 7. who is the peace breakar?
Nat Iudas but Chriſt, yet Iudas doth betraye!
Paule worketh ſedicion, and is no treaſon ſpeakar
ye do the myſchefe,Act. 14. and yet ye make no fraye
The ſame foxe that lurketh, the ſame foxe take the praye
Oh trollynge gnato,Pro. 11. ye thynke ye be not ſeaue
yet by your trollynges, perceyue men what ye meane.

l.hi: But as trollars troblous / and full of enuye
At the lawes of God, and of our good kynge
In ther trollynges do truſt, that ther olde hereſye
All good orders ſet a part / ſhall flory ſhe and ſprynge
Ther prechars no leſſe comfort / in ther ſermons do brynge
Euen latelye exhortinge them, auoydinge all drede
And, perſecucion not regardynge / throughlye to procede.

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: Here is a pretence,Math. 4 to turne ſtones into breade
And a ſuggeſtion, to caſt our ſelues downe bacwarde
Vpon the mountayne, for golde ye trolle vs leade
Lawes with good order, ye wolde vs to regarde
And yet trewe prechars,Nu. 4. ye mynde nat to be harde
Falſe fables ye forge, to darken with ther name
Trollynge in ſoche traſhe, as wyll be to your ſhame
The ſcrybe on hys ſkyrtes,Mat. 23 doth goddes commaundementes ſet
The dcuyll reſembleth, the maſſenger of lyght
Who deſtroyeth lawes? who doth good order let?
But thoſe pharyſees, that chryſten peple ſpyght
Sendynge ſoche prophetes,Hie. 23. as the daye change to the nyght
All them that abhorre, ther olde pylde popetrye
For the worde of God, they accuſe of hereſye.

l.hi: Wyth manye wordes more troblous / than now I wyl reherce
Not doubtynge at all / but at length they ſhall be knowne
Soche trollynge trecherous, my hart doth ſore perce
Conſyderynge how ſedycyouſlye / amonge vs they be ſowne
Of late I well truſted, they hath bene ouerblowne
But now I wyll perceyue / that neyther fauer nor ſmart,
From the bodye can expell / that is roted in the hart

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: More woldeye trolle out,Ioan. 7. yfye coude more reherce
Ye ſhall do nomore, than God ſhall you permyt
Whych trolleth forth tyrauntes, both terryble and ferce
Hys flocke to correct,Iob. 23. whan they trolle out of wyt
Amonge ſoche trollars, ye are a trollar fyt
And I can ye thanke, ye do full well your kynde
Trollynge now ſoche hate, as laye longe in your mynde.
All ys ſedicyon,Ioan. 21. that pleaſe not popyſhe hartes
All inſurreccyon, whan menne from you declyne
Of your ſort manye, hath trolled trayterous partes
And yet agaynſt them, no trollynges ye dyffyne
One relygyous zele,Act. 23. doth you and them combyne
All heretyckes frelye, ye maye touche in your ſpyght
But none ſoche as dyed, for holye churches rycht.

l.hi: A trewe trollynge hart / wold be lothe to pretende
Anye purpoſe to mayntayne / agaynſt God or hye kynge
The confeſſyon of an heretyck / that latelye ded offende
And amonges others / ſuffred for hys deſeruynge
Seſecrettelye they embrace / as moſt precyous thynge
And yet playnelye wyll I proue / by good lawe and reaſon
Contayned therin / bothe he reſye and treaſon.

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: A trewe trollynge hart, dwelleth not wythin your boſome
For all the colours that you ſhewe outwardelye
In the confeſſyon, whych came an heretycke frome
Ys moche lefle treaſon,1. Tim. 4 and moche leſſe hereſye
Than in the trollynges, of your hypocreſye
Whyls you ſhall contende, wyth reaſon and with lawe
Your trolled ſcripturs, proue you a dottynge dawe.
The heretycke that dyed, as all the peple harde
In the fayth of Chriſt,Sapi. 5. mekelye departed hence
Praynge for our kynge, and our worthye prince Edwarde
Longe dayes to endure, inther prehemynence
In hys confeſſion, I fynde none other offence.1. Tim. 2
But as Chriſt doth ſaye, ſoch ſlayghtes are in the ſectes
As wolde in maner, deceyue the verye electes.

l.hi: In anye wyfe imprynted / they wyll nat yt ſhall be
The dauugers therof / in themſelues myſtruſtynge
Wherfor euer ye manne / maye well pexceyue and ſe
What hartes they do beare / to God and our good kynge
Euerye of them ſecretlye / muſt haue yt in wrytynge
But Chriſt fayth verelye / ther is nothynge conceled
But at length ſhall be knowen / and openlye reueled.
l.note: Nihil opertū ꝙ non reuele tur. Mat. 10

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: It is imprynted, wherfore by lawe and reaſon
Proue I can ryght well,Eccl. 7. that ye alyar be
Verye hote ye are, in iu gynge menne of treaſon
The hydden ſecretes, of all mennes hartes ye ſe
As ye iuge ye are, by holy ſaint Paules decre
Soche tauntynge trollars,Rom. 2. are tetrici thraſones
And in ther trollynges, full nought ye nebulones
A ſcripture ye trolle, as dyd the deuyllin deſert
To ſerue your purpofe,Math. 4 trollynge the pythe aſyde
Hydde ſecretes ſayth Criſt, ſhall now be clere and apert
Meanynge ſoche ſcripturs,Luc. 12. as the pharyſees ded hyde
With ther tradicions, hypocreſye and pryde
Thus Chriſt declareth it, in the. xij. chapter of Luke
Falſe trollynge of textes, wyll turne ye to rebuke.

l.hi: Who agaynſt them trolleth / a papyſt they hym name
They haue none other thynge, them ſelues for to defren de
I wolde that all papyſtes / had an open ſhame
And that all heretyckes / themſelues wolde a mende
Than ſhuld we haue no cauſe / further to contende
But vniformelye to lyue / to one with the other
And ioy fullye to in habite / as brother wyth brother.
l.note:
Ecce
que bo num &
que 10 cundū, Pſa. 132

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: We call them papiſtes,Iudae. i. that maintayne papiſtrye
Both hauynge ther frutes; and ſcripture for vs to laye
If all ſoche papyſtes, ſchuld haue ſhame openlye
I thynke ye coude not, befarre out of the waye
As Iudas wyth Chriſt,Pſ. 27. with heretyckes here ye playe
No brother is he, that goddes wurde doth nat furder
Except he be Cain, whych doth pore Abel murder.
Styll ye trolle ſcripturs,2. cor. 6 but nothynge in ther kynde
Couetinge full ſore, to haue a fleſ helye concorde
Beliall and Chriſt, wer neuer of one mynde
Dauid commended,Pſ. 132. a vnite in the Lorde
Which with your peltrye wylleth vs not to accorde
For lyght with darkenes, ſchall neuer well agre
Nor popyſhe falſehede, with Chriſtis veryte.

l.hi: Soche ſchuld be our trollynges / Chriſt vs ſo tracheth
l.note: Deꝰ charitas eſt qui manet in charitate. 1. Ioā. 4.

l.hi: Commandinge euer peace / amonge vs for to be
Hntrewlye he trolleth / that otherwyſe preacheth
Sturrynge to anye ſedicyon, malyce or enmyte
Where bannyſhed vs dyſcorde / and raygneth all charyte
That realme in God reſteth / and God ys in yt
Beinge charyte him ſelf / as ſayth the holye wryt

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: Chriſt neuer trolled,Eſa. 57. ſoche peace as ye wolde haue
Neyther in Mathew, in Luke, nor yet in Iohan
Thowgh in your trollynges, ye falſel ye them depraue
Of olde cankred ſcribes, the armoure ye do on
Nat Barrabas but Chriſt,Ioā. 18, accuſynge of ſedicyon
To the worlde ſayth Chriſt, I ſende no peace but the ſworde
By the which ys ment, the rygour of goddes worde.
ye trolle forth your textes,Mat. 7. commixtynge perles with draffe
For Chriſt ſayd in dede, they ſhuld be troden of ſwyne
Non eſt pax impijs, your charyte ys but chaffe
Though ye crye pax pax, as Eſaye doth dyffyne
ye ſpeke of charyte,Ioan. 16. and drawe by an other lyne
Chriſt ſayd, that with you, we ſhuld haue trybulacyon
And in him alone, our peace and conſolacyon.

l.hi: Than towardes that charyte / trolle we on apace
l.note: Venite ad me omnes qui laboratis &. Math. 15

l.hi: Auauncynge our ſelues / with all conuenyent ſpede
A more accept able pilgrymage / ſurelye neuer was
For whych God gaue to man, anye meryte or mede
Our labour or great burden / let vs nothynge drede
Nor regarde the wylfulnes / of our bodye or fleſhe
For at the iournayes ende / Chriſt wyll vs refreſhe

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: If ye trolle to Chriſt, as ye mynde nothynge leſſe
With the phariſe,Luc. 18 ye maye not your ſelf auaunce
For mede or meryte, as ye do here expreſſe
For non can deſerue,Rom. 11 the heuyns in herytaunce
But here men maye ſe, your trollynge ignoraunce
The frutes of our fleſche, ye myll vs not to regarde
So trollynge vs Chriſt, full lyke a wanton ſtewarde.
Than trolle ye ſcripture,Math. 11 that Chriſt wyll you refreſbe
At your iournayes ende, for your gret labour, and peyne
Chriſt ther taketh the lawe, for the burden of ourfleſhe
Eaſynge our conſcyence, of mennys tradicyons pleyne
But in your trollyn ge, ye haue an other veyne
In your cottacyon,Deu. 13. for the aleuynt of Mathewe
ye trolle the fyſtent, to be knowne a trollar trewe.

l.hi: • nd than as trewe trollars / togyther let vs remayne
l.note: omnis anima poteſta tibusſublimioribꝰ ſub. Ro. 13.

l.hi: Perfyghtlye faſt knyt / in one peace / vnyte and loue
Wyth glorie vnto God / euerm ore gladde and fayne
Our noble prynce trewlye / to ſerue as doth vs behoue
And all others to tendre / as dewtye doth vs moue
Bſynge ſtyll amonge vs the ſelf ſame loue and concorde
Whych ys to vs commaunded / by Chriſt the eternall lorde

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: Thys trollynge wer good,1. Pe. 2. yfye coude folowe yt
And nomore couete, to haue them ouerblowne
That fauer godde strewthe, as they ſuppoſe moſt fyt
Of Chriſten peple, in thys lyfe to beknowne
Reportynge by ſoche,Hier. 9. ſedycyon to be ſowne
ye neyther trolle peace, nor a chriſten amyte
But declare your ſelf, an ympe of inyquyte.
We muſt loue in Chriſt,Ioh. 15. yf we loue chriſtenlye
For loue out of Chriſt, is but a paganes loue
In goddes worde therfore, let vs loue to hys glorye
And obeye our kynge,Rom. 13 as chriſten menne behoue
With mekenes of hart and no ſedicion moue
And than ſhall we trolle, in peaceable vnyte
As God vs wylleth, by hys heuenlye veryte.

l.hi: And now in that loue / let vs all with one voyce praye
For the preſeruacyon / of henry our moſte noble kynge
And Kateryne our quene / that they togyther maye
Proſperouſlye contynew / to ther hartes deſyrynge
And Edwarde our prynce, that moſte angelykt thynge
That they all togyther / maye longe lyue and reſt
And after with hym raygne, qui in celis eſt. Amen.

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: Nat onely with voyce,Math. 6 as dyd the hypocrytes
But whan ye ſhall praye, praye from the very hart
Expreſſynge the fayth, of chriſten Iſraelytes
And trolle with your prynce, no ſyckle flatterynge part
Leaſt after thys lyfe,Pro. 27 ye trolle to eternall ſmart
Better is a ſtrype, of hym which is a frynde
Than a kyſſe of hym, that beareth a wycked mynde.
In fayth and in ſpyryt,Iohā. 4. let vs of God requyre
Our Kynge, Quene, and Prynce, to lyue here proſperouſlye
Not as you do trolle, vnto ther hartes deſyre
But vnto goddes mynde,1. Tim. 2 and of hys name the glorye
Thus trolleth ſaynt Paule, with Abacuch and Hieremye
Lorde graunt them longe lyfe, to thy ſwete wyll and pleaſure
Thy flocke rewlynge here, which is thy moſt deare treaſure

p.hi: God ſaue the kynge. And hys ofſprynge, Amen.

l.hi: To trolle awaye or trolle in / let not trolle ſpare
Yf trolle trewlye trolle / trolle nedeth not to care

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: Betwixt hys trolle and trolle, yf trolle no better trolle
Trolle maye trolle with trollars, that trolle the goſſyppes bolle
Yf trolle wyll trolle with trollars, let trolle trolle veryte
Or elstrolle with yll trollars,Iohā. 9. wyll trolle dyſhoneſte
Where trolle hath trolled vntrewly, let trolle trolle back agayn
For trollinge with yll trollars, trolleth many one to payne

l.hi: Compoſed by Thomas ſmy the / ſeruaunt to the kynges
Royall mageſte / And clarke of the Quenes graces, ounſell (though moſt vnworthye.)

lg.head: An anſwere.
lg.l: The Pharyſe in dede
Hys phylacterye ſprede.
Hys ſkyrtes he doth dylate
To fourny ſhe hys eſtateMat. 23.
The ſcrybe ſet forth hys hemme
With perle and with gemme
With many tytles proude
The pore trouthe to out croude
•• e paynteth hym ſelfe with penne
〈◊〉 or to be ſeane of menneLuc. 11.
Here mayſter ſmythe muſt be
To the kynges hygh mageſte
A ſeruaunt ſcant ſo ſymple
As reynarde vnder a wymple
A clerke,Hier. 8. a lerned manne
Which worldlye cauteles canne
Yea, clerke of the Quenes counſell
And perſecuteth the Goſpell
Yet is he moſte vnworthye
And that he ſpeketh trewlye1. Ioh. 4.
Thys worke he hath compoſed
Wherin he hath not gloſed
By colours of hypocreſye
By falſehede nor by vayne glorye
Nomore than reynarde foxe
Or fryre with hys boxe
It is good by ſaint IoneMat. 7.
That preſtes haue ſoche a wone
As canne ſo clerkelye wryte
and poetelye indyte
Whych wyll not from them wauer
and is in ſo great fauer
Beynge the kynges ſeruaunt
So wyttye and ſo pregnaunt
He that ſhall with hym ſcole
Wyll fynde hym no ſmall fole.Heſt. 3.
None heretycke now ſhall rowte
Nor dare put forth hys ſnowte
But wyll plucke in hys hornesActu. 4.
as doth new ale in cornes
The goſpellarsnow wyll ſhrynke
and not be able to wynke
The knaues ſhall nomore checke
Nor agaynſt vs popyſtes beckeGen. 39
With hym they dare not dallye
For feare of Putiphars vallye
or els for Daniels deane
But now ſynge in a meane.Dani. 6.
Nowe maye we tythes home trolle
and care but for the bolle
We maye let the goſpell goo
For he is our mortall foo
We are fortunate thys tyde
To haue ſmythe on our ſyde.Ioan. 7.
Our kyngdome wolde els fall
